title: How to Use a Flint Stick

steps.title: Put dried grass, leaves, or paper into a small pile that will be used as tinder.
steps.content: Put dried grass, leaves, or paper into a small pile that will be used as tinder. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Put the flint stick end near the edge of the pile.
steps.content: Put the flint stick end near the edge of the pile.

steps.title: Use the piece of steel to scrape the flint roughly, causing sparks to go into the pile.
steps.content: Use the piece of steel to scrape the flint roughly, causing sparks to go into the pile. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Continue until the fire starts.
steps.content: Continue until the fire starts. (If no fire is created from sparks alone, scrape some of the flint into filings on your tinder; then light these filings with sparks) [3] X Research source

steps.title: To keep the fire going, add dry wood of gradually increasing size.
steps.content: To keep the fire going, add dry wood of gradually increasing size. [4] X Research source
